messages.content: What is the purpose of ComfyUI-PickScore-Nodes?
ComfyUI-PickScore-Nodes are image scoring nodes for ComfyUI that use PickScore to predict which images in a batch best match a given prompt.

To install ComfyUI-PickScore-Nodes, clone the repository to the `custom_nodes` directory using the command: `git clone https://github.com/Zuellni/ComfyUI-PickScore-Nodes custom_nodes/ComfyUI-PickScore-Nodes`.
What does the Loader node in ComfyUI-PickScore-Nodes do?
The Loader node in ComfyUI-PickScore-Nodes loads scoring models from Hugging Face or a given directory. By default, it uses the yuvalkirstain/PickScore_v1 model.
What is the function of the Processor node in ComfyUI-PickScore-Nodes?
The Processor node in ComfyUI-PickScore-Nodes takes images and text and converts them into inputs for the Selector node.
How does the Selector node in ComfyUI-PickScore-Nodes work?

The Selector node in ComfyUI-PickScore-Nodes selects up to `limit` images and passes them to other nodes along with latents/masks of the same shape. It interrupts processing if the `threshold` isn't reached.
Is there an example workflow available for ComfyUI-PickScore-Nodes?
Yes, an example workflow for ComfyUI-PickScore-Nodes is embedded in the provided image and can be opened in ComfyUI.
What is the default scoring model used by the Loader node in ComfyUI-PickScore-Nodes?
The default scoring model used by the Loader node in ComfyUI-PickScore-Nodes is yuvalkirstain/PickScore_v1 from Hugging Face.
